content:
You're thinking of adding some extra embellishments to your candles to make them even more special. I think that's a great idea!

**Ribbons or Twine on Candles:**

* Adding ribbons or twine to your candles can add a touch of elegance and sophistication to your display.
* Choose a ribbon or twine that complements the color scheme of your candles and the overall aesthetic of your display.
* Consider the texture and material of the ribbon or twine. A natural fiber like cotton or jute can add a rustic touch, while a satin or velvet ribbon can add a luxurious feel.
* You can tie the ribbon or twine around the candle in a simple knot or create a more intricate design. Keep it simple or get creative – it's up to you!

**Tips for Adding Ribbons or Twine:**

* Make sure the ribbon or twine is securely tied to the candle to prevent it from coming loose.
* Consider the size and shape of the candle. A larger candle might require a thicker ribbon or twine, while a smaller candle might look better with a more delicate ribbon.
* Don't overdo it. A simple ribbon or twine can be just as effective as a more elaborate design.
* You can also use ribbons or twine to create a cohesive look by using the same material on all the candles or varying the design to create visual interest.

**Reusing Greenery and Adding New Elements:**

* I love that you're reusing the eucalyptus from the Artisan's Fair! It's a great way to reduce waste and create a sense of continuity.
* Adding small pinecones and decorative stones will create a beautiful, natural look that complements your candles. The textures and colors will add depth and visual interest to your display.
* Remember to balance the arrangement by distributing the decorative elements evenly throughout the display.

You're doing a great job of thinking creatively and incorporating elements from your previous display to create a unique and cohesive look. I'm excited to see how it all comes together!
